amendment.description: Amendment sought to reduce the DOE fossil energy and research and development account by $188.65 million and provide $183.65 million for land acquisition programs and $5 million for urban park and recreation recovery programs.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 32 in the Congressional Record of July 11, to reduce the funds appropriated in the bill for fossil energy research and development by $184 million and to use those funds to restore federal land acquisition programs to FY 1995 funding levels.

action.text: Miller (CA) amendment (A008) modified by unanimous consent. Modification to specify that a portion of the reprogrammed funds be designated to carry out the provisions of the Urban Park and Recreation Recovery Act of 1978.
On agreeing to the Miller (CA) amendment (A008) as modified Failed by recorded vote: 170 - 253 (Roll no. 502).
